definitions.definition: Able to be known or seen by everyone ; happening without concealment ; open to general view .
Open to all members of a community , as opposed to only a segment of it; especially, provided by national or local authorities and supported by money from taxes .

subdefinitions.definition: Of a company : having shares of stock traded publicly , for example, through a stock market .

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the people as a whole , as opposed to a group of people; concerning the whole community or country .
Officially representing the community; carried out or funded by the government or state on behalf of the community, rather than by a private organization .
Pertaining to a person in the capacity in which they deal with other people on a formal or official basis , as opposed to a personal or private capacity; official, professional .
Of an object : accessible to the program in general , not only to a class or subclass .
definitions.label_groups: not comparable , by extension , object-oriented programming

subdefinitions.definition: Pertaining to nations collectively , or to nations regarded as civilized ; international , supernational .
Now chiefly in public spirit and public-spirited : seeking to further the best interests or well-being of the community or nation.
Now only in public figure : famous , prominent , well-known .

definitions.definition: In some older universities in the United Kingdom : open or pertaining to the whole university, as opposed to a constituent college or an individual staff member or student .

subdefinitions.definition: Of or pertaining to the human race as a whole; common , universal .
Chiefly in make public : of a work : printed or otherwise published .

main_definition: Able to be known or seen by everyone ; happening without concealment ; open to general view . [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: Open to all members of a community , as opposed to only a segment of it; especially, provided by national or local authorities and supported by money from taxes . [from 15th c.]
Pertaining to the people as a whole , as opposed to a group of people; concerning the whole community or country . [from 15th c.]
Officially representing the community; carried out or funded by the government or state on behalf of the community, rather than by a private organization . [from 15th c.]
Pertaining to a person in the capacity in which they deal with other people on a formal or official basis , as opposed to a personal or private capacity; official, professional .
( not comparable , by extension , object-oriented programming ) Of an object : accessible to the program in general , not only to a class or subclass .

( UK , education , chiefly historical ) In some older universities in the United Kingdom : open or pertaining to the whole university, as opposed to a constituent college or an individual staff member or student .
